member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FREADONLY
member.summary: Assignment to the variable should not be allowed.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FSOURCE
member.summary: The variable returns an object that is a source of events.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FREQUESTEDIT
member.summary: When set, any attempt to directly change the property results in a call to IPropertyNotifySink.OnRequestEdit. The implementation of OnRequestEdit determines if the change is accepted.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FDISPLAYBIND
member.summary: The variable is displayed to the user as bindable. VARFLAG_FBINDABLE must also be set.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FDEFAULTBIND
member.summary: The variable is the single property that best represents the object. Only one variable in type information can have this attribute.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FHIDDEN
member.summary: The variable should not be displayed to the user in a browser, although it exists and is bindable.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FRESTRICTED
member.summary: The variable should not be accessible from macro languages. This flag is intended for system-level variables or variables that you do not want type browsers to display.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FDEFAULTCOLLELEM
member.summary: Permits an optimization in which the compiler looks for a member named "xyz" on the type of abc. If such a member is found and is flagged as an accessor function for an element of the default collection, then a call is generated to that member function. Permitted on members in dispinterfaces and interfaces; not permitted on modules.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FUIDEFAULT
member.summary: The variable is the default display in the user interface.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FNONBROWSABLE
member.summary: The variable appears in an object browser, but not in a properties browser.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FREPLACEABLE
member.summary: Tags the interface as having default behaviors.

member.name: VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FIMMEDIATEBIND
member.summary: The variable is mapped as individual bindable properties.
